Package views

Class LivesViewTest

java.lang.Object
views.LivesViewTest
public class LivesViewTest
extends java.lang.Object

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    LivesViewTest()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    (package private) void invalidInitialisation()
    We cannot allow a negative number of lives to be displayed; throwing is the only reasonable action.
    (package private) void makePanel()  
    (package private) void staticSpritesAreNullBeforeInstantiation()
    We expect the static array of sprites to be null before an instance of the view exists.
    (package private) void staticSpritesHaveCorrectLengthAfterInstantiation()
    We expect the initialisation with a valid number of lives to create a static array of sprites of the same length.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • LivesViewTest

      public LivesViewTest()

  • Method Details

    • makePanel

      @BeforeEach void makePanel()

    • invalidInitialisation

      @Test void invalidInitialisation()
      We cannot allow a negative number of lives to be displayed; throwing is the only reasonable action. If we coped with such a scenario, lots of handling code would have to be propagated throughout the codebase.

    • staticSpritesAreNullBeforeInstantiation

      @Test void staticSpritesAreNullBeforeInstantiation()
      We expect the static array of sprites to be null before an instance of the view exists.

    • staticSpritesHaveCorrectLengthAfterInstantiation

      @Test void staticSpritesHaveCorrectLengthAfterInstantiation()
      We expect the initialisation with a valid number of lives to create a static array of sprites of the same length.
